page.title: 10Wybunbury Delves School
page.content:
The present day school is built around what was originally the Delves Charity School.This was built in 1822 for local boys, the girls attending school in what is now the village hall.
The school became mixed in 1958 and since then has had to be extended, first in 1964, when the school opened under its present name: Wybunbury Delves Church of England (Aided) Primary School. A second extension had to be added to the school in 1978, due to over-crowding.
The Delves Trust, who had the school built, today issues an annual grant to the school for pupils' prizes. Wybunbury School is the only one of the three schools built by the Trust which is still in the Foundation.
